snippet.textDisplay: @metalmayhem007 OK, I'll keep it in mind, thanks for the advice!

snippet.textDisplay: @Arc13 Ah ok, but you should know "The Answer" (name of epilogue)  is only available in hard mode, and the after end of game your stats resets back to 20 something i heard. It is a huge grind from what i've been told and there are no S Links to do, just dungeons only with few cutscenes. If this doesn't put you off i say go for it, or you can always watch the cutscenes of it on youtube and lay psp version
snippet.textOriginal: @Arc13 Ah ok, but you should know "The Answer" (name of epilogue)  is only available in hard mode, and the after end of game your stats resets back to 20 something i heard. It is a huge grind from what i've been told and there are no S Links to do, just dungeons only with few cutscenes. If this doesn't put you off i say go for it, or you can always watch the cutscenes of it on youtube and lay psp version

snippet.textDisplay:
@metalmayhem007 I think I could adapt, unlike many I actually enjoyed FFXIII, although that battle system was much more complex(not the game itself, Persona is ahead by miles, just the battle system, easily XIII's best aspect and what pushed me through).
I'm not sure which to go with honestly, I want extra features but knowing this knowledge now, 3 would be improved if I had access to my whole party(not to mention get me a little closer to their characters).
snippet.textOriginal:
@metalmayhem007 I think I could adapt, unlike many I actually enjoyed FFXIII, although that battle system was much more complex(not the game itself, Persona is ahead by miles, just the battle system, easily XIII's best aspect and what pushed me through).
I'm not sure which to go with honestly, I want extra features but knowing this knowledge now, 3 would be improved if I had access to my whole party(not to mention get me a little closer to their characters).

snippet.textDisplay: @Arc13 Yeah same with me too lol, i played persona 3 portable first and 4 this year. Just a word of warning the ps2 version doesn't allow you to control party members which is why people hate going backwards from P4 to P3 , if you don't like the idea get portable it has same battle as P4. You will miss out on a 30hr epilogue though which is available on P3 FES (ps2 version), although i hear it is not very good.
snippet.textOriginal: @Arc13 Yeah same with me too lol, i played persona 3 portable first and 4 this year. Just a word of warning the ps2 version doesn't allow you to control party members which is why people hate going backwards from P4 to P3 , if you don't like the idea get portable it has same battle as P4. You will miss out on a 30hr epilogue though which is available on P3 FES (ps2 version), although i hear it is not very good.

snippet.textDisplay:
I really like the background music in this game. It's super up-beat and nice to listen to. P4 was such an awesome game. I'll replay it again one of these days (it's just so damn long :/). If there is anything that makes me want a PS Vita right now, it is P4: Golden. 

And I'm extremely excited for Persona 5! (Persona 3 & 4 have basically made me an Atlus fanboy, so long as the game is developed by them).
snippet.textOriginal:
I really like the background music in this game. It's super up-beat and nice to listen to. P4 was such an awesome game. I'll replay it again one of these days (it's just so damn long :/). If there is anything that makes me want a PS Vita right now, it is P4: Golden. 

And I'm extremely excited for Persona 5! (Persona 3 & 4 have basically made me an Atlus fanboy, so long as the game is developed by them).

snippet.textDisplay:
Yay! A song from my all-time favorite video game! :D And an excellent choice too. I have always, and I mean ALWAYS loved hearing this in the game. (BIG improvment on most of the P3 map themes imo)
Oh god, how I can't wait to hear it again when Golden comes out! ^w^ ...When Sony hopefully drops the riduculous price on the Vita XD
Btw, I have been watching the anime too. And while it's great and a REAL gem in anime, I do feel it is kind of rushed. Just sayin'
snippet.textOriginal:
